name: Technical Product manager
description:
Altium has over 30 years of experience in developing software for the design and manufacture of electronic devices.

The company's products such as Altium 365, Altium Designer (formerly Protel), P-CAD, etc. are used by professional electronics developers.

The central office of the company is located in San Diego (California), R&D offices in the USA, Russia, Europe, Asia.

We are a Modern Cloud-based Software as a Service Company, which is developing software and cloud platform for engineering and design of electronic components. We are looking for a Technical product manager (Senior level).

Duties:

  • Research and analyze technology trends in Electronic Design Automation (EDA)
  • Work with enterprise, industry partners, and end-users to identify the key industry trends and opportunities for EDA product development
  • Perform product planning, development, and management
  • Determine key concepts of the software product architecture
  • Define and maintain product roadmaps
  • Supervise pilot projects for new Altium modules and products
  • Coordinate marketing, development, QA, support, and sales team's efforts
  • Provide product launch support for sales and marketing.

Requirements - academic or work experience should include:

  • Software development experience ;
  • Software development processes and flows
  • Quality assurance practices
  • Data-driven approaches for the product and market analysis
  • Business, process and system analysis
  • Requirement management and definition
  • Electronic Design Automation software (as a plus);
  • PCB design knowledge (as a plus);

Benefits:

  • Tasks in a product that differs from most products on the market (mix - complex engineering software, microelectronics, cloud services)
  • Remote work for the near future, then you can stay remotely or work from the office. There are offices in Kyiv, Moscow, and St. Petersburg
  • A good level of salary (discussed individually) with reference to the $ exchange rate, official employment, as well as health insurance, corporate English, and training (books, courses, conferences).
